p.span: You take the purple from the sunset, and the golden from the grain, to make our glorious banner, the emblem of our fame.
And here's to Friendship High, we will shout our victory cry. Here's to the purple and gold, our banner high we hold!

p.span: Ron James will host a virtual assembly on Thursday April 30th.
Students will meet via Zoom at 11 a.m. for High School & 1 p.m. for Middle School.
Check Teams and email for the assembly link!

a.title: Go to comments for April 27, 2020

p.span: Pre-K Registration
If your child is 4 years old, on or before December 1, 2020 click for more information.

span.a: Click to complete the Pre-K Application.

p.span: We continue to provide breakfast and lunch for pickup M-F from 9-11 a.m. We have served over 5,000 meals. Please come to the cafeteria entrance for pickup.
Instruction is continuing through distance learning, please contact the school if you have questions.
Thank you Friendship!

a.title: Go to comments for April 23, 2020,

p.span: The Friendship Central School District Breakfast and Lunch program has served over 4,000 meals during the coronavirus closure. Have you stopped by and picked-up a meal? Meals are served daily M-F from 9-11 a.m. and can be picked-up at the cafeteria door. If you have any questions, please contact the school. Be safe and have a great weekend!

a.title: Go to comments for April 17, 2020

p.span: Caregivers, Friendship Central School is utilizing Microsoft Teams to facilitate distance learning. If you would like more information about Microsoft Teams follow this link:

a.title: Go to comments for April 15, 2020,

p.span: Report cards for the third quarter were mailed last week. If you have any questions please contact the school.
Based on Governor Cuomo’s Executive Order and guidance from the State Education Department, instruction and meals will continue to be provided daily Monday-Friday until further notice.

a.title: Go to comments for April 14, 2020,

p.span: April 8, 2020,

Based on Governor Cuomo’s Executive Order we are providing meals Monday-Friday including Friday April 10, so make sure to come to the cafeteria doors between 9-11 a.m. to pick up breakfast and lunch to go.

Also, the Board of Regents has issued guidance on graduation and course requirements. Please follow this link: http://www.nysed.gov/coronavirus to read more on the NYSED Dedicated Corona Virus update page.

a.title: Go to comments for April 8, 2020

p.span: April 1, 2020,
Based on Governor Cuomo’s Executive Order and guidance from the State Education Department, instruction and meals will be provided daily Monday-Friday until further notice.
Child Care Resource and Referral Agencies (CCRRs) provide services to parents and day care providers in every county of New York State.

If you are looking for child care, the CCRR in your county is a great place to start. They will ask you about the kind of care you are looking for, the ages of your children, the hours of care you need and other specifics such as any special needs your child might have. Based on that information, they will be able to give you a list of providers that most closely meet your needs. Here is a link to the Office and Family Services webpage: https://ocfs.ny.gov/main/childcare/referralagencies.asp
To help your local CCRR please take a moment to complete this brief survey: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/3HSNNYJ

a.title: Go to comments for April 1, 2020,

p.span: Governor Cuomo announced on Friday March 27, 2020, that he is extending school closures for an additional two weeks, until April 15, 2020. The Executive Order is available here: https://www.governor.ny.gov/news/no-20211-continuing-temporary-suspension-and-modification-laws-relating-disaster-emergency.
Although Schools are closed physically, distance learning is continuing. Teachers continue to provide lessons. Please let us know if you need any assistance.
Meals continue to be available Monday-Friday from 9-11 a.m. Breakfast & lunch are provided “to go” in one package for your convenience. Pick-up for meals is at the cafeteria door.
Thanks again to the Friendship Community!

a.title: Go to comments for March 30, 2020, Update

p.span: Distance Learning is up and running. Teachers are reaching out to students and delivering lessons through a variety of virtual methods including video conferences (Zoom), MS Teams, email, telephone, etc. Please let us know if you need any assistance.
Meals continue to be delivered from 9-11 a.m. Monday-Friday. Breakfast & lunch are available to go in one package at the cafeteria door.
Thank you again for all of your support!

a.title: Go to comments for March 25, 2020,

p.span: Meals to go are available Monday - Friday from 9-11 a.m. at the cafeteria door, breakfast and lunch is included for all individuals 18 and under.
We continue to support distance learning and have reached out to all of our community. If you have not heard from us, or if you have any questions, please call the school.
Thank you for your patience, support, and understanding during this challenging time.

a.title: Go to comments for March 24, 2020

p.span: Thank you Friendship Central School Community for all of your help and patience when distributing instructional material and resources. If you have not picked-up material yet, please do so by 3 p.m. today.
If you have special circumstances, please call the school.
School meals will continue to be served Monday - Friday and can be picked-up from 9 - 11 a.m.
Again thank you for working together to help provide service for our community!

a.title: Go to comments for March 20, 2020 Update

span.h3: Please come to the front circle at Friendship Central School during one of the windows below to pick-up school work and devices for your child:

li.h3: Thursday March 19, from 9-11 a.m. or 12-3 p.m.

span.h3: If you have any questions, please call the school.

a.title: Go to comments for Instructional Supplies Pick-up

span.h3: The Backpack Food Program is up and running. If you receive a backpack, you can pick it up at the FCS cafeteria door between 12 and 3 p.m. today, or 9 to 11:30 a.m. Wednesday March 18, 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for Backpack Food Program

h2.span: Drive-Thru, no cost, breakfast & lunch for all children in the Friendship Central School District. Pick-up one package per child (18 and under) daily containing both meals.
Weekdays starting Wednesday, March 18, 2020 from 9 to 11 a.m.
If you have questions, please call (585) 973-3311

a.title: Go to comments for School Foods
Go to comments for Update letter from Mrs. May

p.span: Spectrum is offering free Wi-Fi for 60 days with no installation fees - 1-844-488-8395.

a.title: Go to comments for Internet Access

p.span: Friendship Central School Is Closed Until Further Notice. Essential Personnel Only.

a.title: Go to comments for School Closed - Essential Employees Only

p.span: As of 9:45 pm, the Allegany County Department of Health has recommended that the District not bring students into the building this week. A plan is being developed to distribute instructional material to the students. As soon as the plan is ready, instructions will be posted as to how they will be distributed.

a.title: Go to comments for No Students

span.a: Letter to FCS community regarding coronavirus

a.title: Go to comments for March 15, 2020 Letter to FCS Community

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: March 15, 2020

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: Dear Friendship Central School Families,

p.style: font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; widows: 2; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; word-spacing: 0px;

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: Based on guidance from NYSED, Allegany County Department of Health, and Regional Educational Partners, Friendship Central School is preparing a plan to deliver distance learning/e-learning to minimize the educational disruption due to coronavirus closures.

p.style: font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; widows: 2; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; word-spacing: 0px;

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: Later today, a link to a short survey regarding school meals and technology will be available. Your participation in the survey will be very helpful to planning.

p.style: font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; widows: 2; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; word-spacing: 0px;

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: Please check the website often as the situation is rapidly changing, and we will provide updates as the circumstances develop.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: Thank you for your understanding.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: Sincerely,

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: Superintendent Judy May

a.title: Go to comments for Instructional Plan to address the impact of Coronavirus

p.span: March 13, 2020
Dear Friendship Central School Families,

Based on the guidance of the Allegany County Health Commissioner, the Friendship Central School District is postponing all field trips and sporting competitions until further notice. The circumstances around this looming public health challenge seem to change rapidly. We will take action according to those circumstances, with the guidance of public health officials, in an effort to assure the safety of everyone who learns, works and visits in our schools. Gatherings within our schools that include only our students and staff, such as assemblies, professional learning, student government meetings, etc. will continue as normal.
Sincerely,
Superintendent Judy May
